<title level="1" right="Spell 4" pfs="Standard">[Spiritual Attunement](/Spells.aspx?ID=1001)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 130 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You attune yourself to a spiritual plane of the Outer Sphere (see sidebar), connecting your spirit without fully transporting to it. Your Strikes and spells gain the alignment traits of the plane you chose, which deals additional damage to creatures with a weakness to either of those alignment traits. Furthermore, the plane protects you from energy of the alignments that oppose the plane. You gain resistance 5 to damage of the alignments that oppose those of your chosen plane. For example, if you chose [Heaven](/Planes.aspx?ID=17), your Strikes would gain the [good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83) and [lawful](/Traits.aspx?ID=99) traits, and you would gain resistance to chaotic and evil. If you choose the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15), the resistance is to negative and positive damage instead.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The resistance increases by 5.

<title level="3">The Outer Sphere</title> The nine main planes of the Outer Sphere are the homes of many deities, [celestials](/Traits.aspx?ID=23), [monitors](/Traits.aspx?ID=111), and [fiends](/Traits.aspx?ID=70). Their names, along with their alignments, are: [Heaven](/Planes.aspx?ID=17) (LG), [Nirvana](/Planes.aspx?ID=20) (NG), [Elysium](/Planes.aspx?ID=16) (CG), [Axis](/Planes.aspx?ID=14) (LN), the [Boneyard](/Planes.aspx?ID=15) (N), the [Maelstrom](/Planes.aspx?ID=19) (CN), [Hell](/Planes.aspx?ID=18) (LE), [Abaddon](/Planes.aspx?ID=12) (NE), and the [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13) (CE).
